content.title: Prime Minister’s Scholarship Scheme for the Wards of States/UTs Police Personnel
content.beneficiary: Dependent wards of States/UTs Police Personnel who are martyred during Terror/Naxal attacks
content.details: The “Prime Minister’s Scholarship Scheme (PMSS) for the Wards of States/UTs Police Personnel” is a scholarship scheme which was introduced by the Ministry of Home Affairs, Government of India during the academic session 2019-20 to encourage higher technical & professional education for the dependent wards of States/UTs Police Personnel who are martyred during Terror/Naxal attacks. A total of 500 scholarships will be given to the wards of State Police Personnel who are martyred during Terror/Naxal attacks in equal numbers to the Boys and Girls (i.e. 250 for boys and 250 for girls).
benefits: The above scholarship amount is to be paid annually after selection @ ₹36,000/- to each girl & ₹30,000/- to each boy.
Duration of Scholarship: Up to 5 years (depending upon the duration of the course being pursued by the applicant and as approved by the respective regulatory body).
eligibility: Pursuing first professional degree programme in the field of Engineering, Medicine, Dental, Veterinary, BBA, BCA, B. Pharma, B.SC (Nursing, Agriculture, etc.), MBA and MCA.
Having a minimum of 60% marks in Minimum Entry Qualification (MEQ) i.e. 10+2/Diploma/Graduation or equivalent in case of a new applicant.
For renewal applicants, it is mandatory to pass each subsequent academic year of the professional courses being pursued with a minimum of 50% marks.
A grace period of one year only for cases, where there is a delay on the part of the candidate for submission of application for renewal of scholarship may be entertained.
exclusions: Wards of civilian employees of States/UTs Police personnel.
Applicants pursuing professional courses through correspondence/distance learning.
Applicants availing the benefit of other scholarship schemes/getting stipend and financial assistance.
Applicants already availed scholarship under PMSS.
Applicants pursuing courses, such as Diploma courses, not leading to the award of a degree or pursuing master's degree programme except MBA, MCA subject to first professional course.

Applicants admitted on their own to the college/institute/university NOT APPROVED under UGC Act or not recognized by AICTE and not having NBA accredited courses (for Engineering Degree courses) or Not approved by Medical Council of India (for Medical Degree courses).
Change of course/college by the Selected Student and getting fresh admission in the subsequent academic year will lead to the rejection of his/her Scholarship forever.
content.application_process: Online submission for the scholarship can be done through the website of the National Scholarship Portal with the required documents: https://scholarships.gov.in/
documents_required: A certificate issued by the State Govt. concerned indicating that the State/UTs Police personnel was killed in terror/naxal violence.
Duly attested scanned copy of the Mark sheet MEQ i.e. XII/Diploma/Graduation or equivalent
Any other relevant documents, as required

faqs.question: What is the 'Prime Minister’s Scholarship Scheme for the Wards of States/UTs Police Personnel'?
faqs.answer: The Prime Minister’s Scholarship Scheme (PMSS) is a scholarship program introduced by the Ministry of Home Affairs, Government of India, aimed at encouraging higher technical and professional education for the dependent wards of States/UTs Police Personnel who are martyred during Terror/Naxal attacks.

faqs.question: When was the scheme introduced?
faqs.answer: The scheme was introduced from the academic session 2019-20.

faqs.question: How many scholarships are awarded under the scheme?
faqs.answer: A total of 500 scholarships are awarded, divided equally between boys and girls.

faqs.question: What are the benefits of the Scheme?
faqs.answer: Under the scheme, selected students receive financial assistance as follows: ₹3,000/- per month for girls. ₹2,500/- per month for boys.

faqs.question: How long does the scholarship last?
faqs.answer: The duration of the scholarship is up to 5 years, depending on the duration of the course pursued by the applicant and as approved by the respective regulatory body.

faqs.question: Who is eligible to apply under the scheme?
faqs.answer: Dependent wards of States/UTs Police Personnel who are martyred during Terror/Naxal attacks are eligible to apply under the scheme.

faqs.question: What academic performance is required for eligibility?
faqs.answer: Applicants must have a minimum of 60% marks in their Minimum Entry Qualification (MEQ) i.e. 10+2/Diploma/Graduation or equivalent for new applicants. For renewal applicants, it is mandatory to pass each subsequent academic year of the professional courses being pursued with a minimum of 50% marks.

faqs.question: How to apply for the scholarship?
faqs.answer: Online submission for the scholarship can be done through the website of the National Scholarship Portal with the required documents: https://scholarships.gov.in/
